column4: Guys, I installed the latest nvidia driver manually. How do I enable it now?
Why did you do it manually?  Are you using an old version of Ubuntu?
Because xlv advised me to do so, also, because gutsy installs an older driver
It's been a while since I've done it manually, but I believe the readme on the site walks you through everything
did you have to modify your xorg.conf by hand?  Once you've done that, the next time you start x it should be ok
It's a good idea to print out the readme before you do it... you've got a few steps to follow exactly.  As alil234 says, the latest Ubuntu will install one for you, and it's really easy.
just checked the site, looks like the script they've got there should configure pretty much everything for you
it should, when it completes 'successfully', i reboot, run compiz and then ubuntu tries to install nvidia-glx-new! and im like what theh ell?!?
I've never bothered with compiz... couldn't tell you. :(
it probably doesn't realize you've got it installed, since you didn't install the driver through apt-get / synaptic
your right, thats why i was thinking of to enable it or something ><
so I guess you were having problems with the driver Ubuntu gives you?
I'd still go the Ubuntu way, unless you absolutely can't... less headaches
tried that for like 5 days man, posted everywhere... seems like theres no solution yet....
You could always do compiz manually, too. :D  Not sure how hard that is, though.

If you were to download it and compile it yourself, just as you did with the driver.  But that might be a bit difficult/confusing if you're not used to that kind of thing... and as I said, I've never been into compiz, so I'm not sure what it would take.
